alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Toombs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 3:28PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Toombs and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 328 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over South Thompson, or 8 miles south of Lyons, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lyons, Vidalia, Uvalda, Santa Claus, Alston, Center, Toombs Central, Ohoopee, New Branch, Ponderosa, McNatt Falls, South Thompson, English Eddy, Grays Landing, Rock Springs, Cedar Crossing, Johnson Corner and Charlotteville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
